_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:  

The Sunoco Euless Terminal is committed to operating and maintaining of our process in a safe and responsible manner.  The terminal has an accident release prevention program in place and coordinates with local planners and responders.



Facility operations and regulated substances handled:  

The desulphurization of high sulphur diesel to create ultra-low sulphur diesel process at the Euless Terminal is regulated by the Risk Management Plan regulation (40 CFR 68). The regulated substance is hydrogen which is used in desulphurization. 



General accidental release prevention program and prevention steps: 

 In addition to the Risk Management Plan regulation, the facility is subject to OSHA Process Safety Management Regulations at 29 CFR 1910.119, OSHA Regulations at 29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.120, Clean Water Act Regulations at 40 CFR 112, RCRA Regulations at 40 CFR 264, 265, and 279.52, OPA-90 Regulations at 40 CFR 112, 33 CFR 154, 49 CFR 194, and 30 CFR 254, as well as State EPCRA Rules of Laws.  Key parts of the Euless Terminal accident release program include Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Management of Change, Mechanical Integrity, Incident Investigation, program auditing, and employee participation.



Five-year accident history:  

The Euless Terminal has had no releases of hydrogen in the last five years.



Emergency response program:  

Emergency response at the facility has been coordinated with the Ft Worth Fire Department. In addition, the facility Emergency Response Action Plan and information on the hazardous chemical inventory at the facility have been filed with the State Emergency Response Commission (SERC), the Tarrant County Local Emergency Response Committee (LEPC) and the Ft Worth Fire Department. Finally, the facility is manned 24 hours/day, 7 days/week by operators trained to notify local, state, and federal agencies as part of the immediate response to

a release of hazardous chemicals.



Planned changes to improve safety:  

Upcoming improvements at the facility include upgrading the Mechanical Integrity Program and upgrading the corrosion detection program.
